intro: Stenoptera pilifera, commonly known as the hairy stenoptera, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its hairy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardeners seeking unique foliage.
